item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 1, 2025 at 3:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Static search trees: faster than binary search (152 points | 65 comments)
2. Arnis: Generate cities in Minecraft from OpenStreetMap (231 points | 40 comments)
3. Happy New Year 2025 HN (80 points | 24 comments)
4. I Reversed a Drone and Landed It with My PC (37 points | 2 comments)

6. Building Game Prototypes with LÖVE (93 points | 34 comments)
7. After a 24-second test of its engines, the New Glenn rocket is ready to fly (17 points | 5 comments)
8. Things we learned about LLMs in 2024 (530 points | 394 comments)
9. Signalling chaos: Inside the Elizabeth line's two-day breakdown (6 points | 1 comment)
10. Déjà vu: Ghostly CVEs in my terminal title (23 points | discuss)
11. Morris Chang and the Origins of TSMC (183 points | 52 comments)
12. Penrose Mazes (2020) (58 points | 8 comments)
13. Lies. Damned Lies. P-value thresholds (24 points | 6 comments)
14. Deepseek: The quiet giant leading China’s AI race (330 points | 277 comments)
15. Bench.co acquired after informing staff company was insolvent (16 points | 10 comments)

18. Just Words (YC W24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
19. Shallow Feedback Hollows You Out (12 points | 1 comment)
20. More telcos confirm Salt Typhoon breaches as White House weighs in (361 points | 296 comments)
21. Systems ideas that sound good but almost never work (284 points | 179 comments)
22. I keep turning my Google Sheets into phone-friendly webapps (599 points | 206 comments)
23. Amiga Games Released in 2024 Index (56 points | 9 comments)
24. Dinner for One: British comedy Germans have been laughing at for years (2018) (107 points | 58 comments)
25. How to monitor your local weather with Grafana (170 points | 38 comments)
26. Show HN: Watch 3 AIs compete in real-time stock trading (209 points | 168 comments)
27. AI companies cause most of traffic on forums (557 points | 328 comments)
28. 3D-printed neighborhood nears completion in Texas (20 points | 30 comments)
29. Coconut by Meta AI – Better LLM Reasoning with Chain of Continuous Thought? (333 points | 138 comments)
30. App Should Have Been a Website (and Probably Your Game Too) (202 points | 296 comments)
